Jan 24

Rest In Peace to a Hip Hop Revolutionary

Founder and CEO of Worldstarhiphop.com, Lee O’Denat (or Q), died in his sleep late Monday night.

WorldstarHiphop became a staple in, not only Hip Hop music, but the Hip Hop culture overall. Since the evolution of the internet, Worldstarhiphop.com was the one of the primary successful platforms that shined light and breathed new air into several entertainers that ultimately jumpstarted their brand and turned them into a business.

There’s no doubt that the site had its fair share of critique because of the exploitation of troubled children, however, without a doubt, it internationalized the culture, which showed the good with the bad.

Q premiered the site in 2005, at the age of 32, initially starting with posting mixtapes for up and coming artists. It gradually progressed to a video platform, showing everything from music videos, to the latest news stories, to extreme fights, and more. As visuals became more prevalent on the internet, Worldstar started to build rapid traction.

Worldstarhiphop.com has changed the game for sure!

It is said that Q has died from a heart attack, but the autopsy is yet to take place.

Rest in Peace!
